issue.title: Your take on the ReCycle-GAN

repository.name: faceswap-GAN
repository.description: A denoising autoencoder + adversarial losses and attention mechanisms for face swapping.

issue.body:
I know this is not an issue but I wanted to know your take on the ReCycle-GAN approach for deepfakes. Could it be better than the current approaches or does it have ups and downs which makes it useless for deepfakes?

Here's a [link to a YouTube video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IkmhU2UmgqM) and here's the [paper's link](https://arxiv.org/abs/1808.05174).

body:
As is known to all， GAN is hard to learn, unlike AE.
try to run more epoch/iteration to see what will happen. If you only run a few iteration, it's normal to see this meaningless image.
What‘s more, you can change the resolution to reduce learning difficulty.
Batch size=1 is too erratic, which may go against the learning

decreased res to 128x128 and changed generator to UNet from Resnet, speed increased x2 per epoch. and allows set x4 more batch size.

changed norm layer to GroupNormalization, training became stable...

with GroupNormalization , discriminator loss varies near 1.0

![python_2018-12-25_18-28-57](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8076202/50423749-f0c13a80-0872-11e9-82f8-c24c383913ab.jpg)

By any chance, could you write a quick instruction on implementing the pasted code or do you @iperov have plans to add it as another model to the code base? I have a powerful GPU, so I can probably test the model with large amounts of training in a short amount of time.
yes I have plan to add it to repo in case of success adaptation to keras

Definitely would be valuable to have this added to DFL, if possible . I've been playing around with the official Recycle-GAN repo but am getting poor results (https://github.com/aayushbansal/Recycle-GAN/issues/9)

Actually Im trying to port from aayushbansal/Recycle-GAN,
but looks like his port is wrong

I found another implementation of RecycleGAN https://github.com/SerialLain3170/VideoProcessing/tree/master/Recycle-GAN
and it is differs from aayushbansal/Recycle-GAN

I can test this on 4 Tesla GPU’s when the code is ready.

________________________________
Fra: iperov <notifications@github.com>
Sendt: fredag, desember 28, 2018 2:56 pm
Til: iperov/DeepFaceLab
Kopi: Subscribed
Emne: Re: [iperov/DeepFaceLab] trying to implement RecycleGAN (#82)


I found another implementation of RecycleGAN https://github.com/SerialLain3170/VideoProcessing/tree/master/Recycle-GAN
and it is differs from aayushbansal/Recycle-GAN

—
You are receiving this because you are subscribed to this thread.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub<https://github.com/iperov/DeepFaceLab/issues/82#issuecomment-450362951>, or mute the thread<https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AjWpDqcPrxPUTPlPxOF0FaXckLPfwjTbks5u9iMpgaJpZM4ZghC->.
I can only access the 16 gb versions
4 gpu with 16 gb each

@Eleganze I committed. 
Now you can test RecycleGAN.

workspace with Putin/Navalny
https://mega.nz/#!f9k3xCCD!fcJkAlWVBg3FhCVK-6N4nwsKm14K_C0aa73TLOIWUq4
or you can use your own data. Place any square images to aligned folders

6) train RecycleGAN hist.bat :
```
@echo off
call _internal\setenv.bat

%PYTHON_EXECUTABLE% %OPENDEEPFACESWAP_ROOT%\main.py train ^
    --training-data-src-dir %WORKSPACE%\data_src\aligned ^
    --training-data-dst-dir %WORKSPACE%\data_dst\aligned ^
    --model-dir %WORKSPACE%\model ^
    --model RecycleGAN ^
    --write-preview-history
pause
```

model will ask batch size on first run. Find max for your 16GB before OOM please and report me.

also you can change resolution in model py file
> resolution = 128

I have 6 batch size on 6GB GPU , 128 resolution,
at some point model collapses

![003370](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8076202/50523006-49007280-0ae7-11e9-9717-5d52307fdc8a.jpg)

![003380](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8076202/50523009-4b62cc80-0ae7-11e9-8133-39f1ce965740.jpg)
now I started 64x64 with 24 batch size
hmm really 24 batch size is more stable
I will give it a show now!

with batch size 24 discriminator fluctuating heavily, but generator stable
![python_2018-12-28_22-57-11](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8076202/50525291-fed1be00-0af3-11e9-9411-760d8fc8b533.jpg)

Project started fine with batch size 16 at 128x128 resolution.

![bs162](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37071118/50525377-f9b04700-0ad2-11e9-9dc4-73d62357b0a6.PNG)
![bs16](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37071118/50525378-f9b04700-0ad2-11e9-84ab-e6ff5cd1ab9c.PNG)
@Eleganze  try 256x256 and 24 batch size
